<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_add_response_header:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_add_response_header (struct MHD_Response *response,
                         const char *header,
                         const char *content)
{
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (header, MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONNECTION))
    return add_response_header_connection (response, content);

  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (header,
                               MHD_HTTP_HEADER_TRANSFER_ENCODING))
  {
    if (! MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (content, "chunked"))
      return MHD_NO;   /* Only "chunked" encoding is allowed */
    if (0 != (response->flags_auto & MHD_RAF_HAS_TRANS_ENC_CHUNKED))
      return MHD_YES;  /* Already has "chunked" encoding header */
    if ( (0 != (response->flags_auto & MHD_RAF_HAS_CONTENT_LENGTH)) &&
         (0 == (MHD_RF_INSANITY_HEADER_CONTENT_LENGTH & response->flags)) )
      return MHD_NO; /* Has "Content-Length" header and no "Insanity" flag */
    if (MHD_NO != add_response_entry (response,
                                      MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                                      header,
                                      content))
    {
      response->flags_auto |= MHD_RAF_HAS_TRANS_ENC_CHUNKED;
      return MHD_YES;
    }
    return MHD_NO;
  }
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (header,
                               MHD_HTTP_HEADER_DATE))
  {
    if (0 != (response->flags_auto & MHD_RAF_HAS_DATE_HDR))
    {
      struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *hdr;
      hdr = MHD_get_response_element_n_ (response, MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                                         MHD_HTTP_HEADER_DATE,
                                         MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ( \
                                           MHD_HTTP_HEADER_DATE));
      mhd_assert (NULL != hdr);
      _MHD_remove_header (response, hdr);
      if (NULL != hdr->value)
        free (hdr->value);
      free (hdr->header);
      free (hdr);
    }
    if (MHD_NO != add_response_entry (response,
                                      MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                                      header,
                                      content))
    {
      response->flags_auto |= MHD_RAF_HAS_DATE_HDR;
      return MHD_YES;
    }
    return MHD_NO;
  }

  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (header,
                               MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_LENGTH))
  {
    /* Generally MHD sets automatically correct "Content-Length" always when
     * needed.
     * Custom "Content-Length" header is allowed only in special cases. */
    if ( (0 != (MHD_RF_INSANITY_HEADER_CONTENT_LENGTH & response->flags)) ||
         ((0 != (MHD_RF_HEAD_ONLY_RESPONSE & response->flags)) &&
          (0 == (response->flags_auto & (MHD_RAF_HAS_TRANS_ENC_CHUNKED
                                         | MHD_RAF_HAS_CONTENT_LENGTH)))) )
    {
      if (MHD_NO != add_response_entry (response,
                                        MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                                        header,
                                        content))
      {
        response->flags_auto |= MHD_RAF_HAS_CONTENT_LENGTH;
        return MHD_YES;
      }
    }
    return MHD_NO;
  }

  return add_response_entry (response,
                             MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                             header,
                             content);
}
```
</target_code>

explanation:
The MISRA Rule 17.2 concern is direct or indirect recursion (a function calling itself). The above fragments are all call-sites in this function that could potentially lead to indirect recursion if the callee(s) call back into MHD_add_response_header. They therefore require investigation of the called functions' implementations to ensure no path leads back to MHD_add_response_header.

Other code fragments in this function do not need investigation for Rule 17.2 because they are simple, non-calling operations or standard library/utility calls that do not create recursion risk:
- The MHD_str_equal_caseless_ calls are ordinary string-comparison helpers and do not modify response headers or perform callbacks; they are not expected to call into MHD_add_response_header.
- mhd_assert is an assertion/check macro and does not invoke application callbacks that could cause recursion.
- free is the standard C library memory deallocation function and cannot call back into application header-manipulation routines.
- MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ is a compile-time macro for string length computation.
- Simple flag checks, bitwise operations, assignments and return statements in this function do not initiate function calls that could recurse.

Therefore, only the listed call-sites (calls to add_response_header_connection, add_response_entry, MHD_get_response_element_n_, and _MHD_remove_header) are potential sources of indirect recursion and should be inspected in their definitions to confirm compliance with MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2.
